law.catch_line: The office of a director becomes vacant if the director:...

text.section:
The office of a director becomes vacant if the director:
Dies;
Resigns; or
Is removed.

A director may be removed from office:
By the board, in accordance with the bylaws, if the director:
Does not possess or maintain the qualifications required to serve on the board; or
Is absent from three consecutive regular meetings of the board unless excused; or
By the members.

section.section: Unless the bylaws provide otherwise, the remaining directors by majority vote shall fill a vacancy.
A director elected by the board to fill a vacancy holds office as the bylaws provide.
